meanings.definition: A political system in which the state has substantial centralized control over social and economic affairs.
meanings.sent1: Statism can be seen in countries where the government has a lot of power over everything.
meanings.sent2: In statism, the state plays a big role in making decisions about the economy and society.
meanings.sent3: The idea of statism might make some people feel like the government is always watching them.
meanings.sent4: Statism is like a giant umbrella that covers all aspects of a nation's life.
meanings.sent5: The concept of statism is like a heavy weight pressing down on individual freedoms.

meanings.definition: The practice or doctrine of giving a centralized government control over economic planning and policy.
meanings.sent1: Statism in economic planning means the government decides what is produced and how it is distributed.
meanings.sent2: Some countries follow statism by allowing the government to make all the important economic decisions.
meanings.sent3: When it comes to statism, the government becomes the ultimate boss of the economy.
meanings.sent4: Statism in economic policy is like having a strict teacher who controls every aspect of your work.
meanings.sent5: The idea of statism in economic planning is like a puzzle where the government holds all the pieces.
